content.raw:
> An extra service probably doesn't add a lot of overhead

Yup, that's most likely true

> but most people will want it always on

I agree lots of people will want it on, but we shouldn't forget all the Gazebo instances being launched for CI and testing, which are usually headless.

> I can imagine a more likely scenario where users forget to include this System and then the GUI doesn't work

Agreed that users may forget it, but that's also true for the `SceneBroadcaster`, which is needed by the GUI (for now, we may change that once we have distributed systems).

As for the GUI not working, that's not really true, users could always launch an empty `ign gui` window and insert plugins as needed. Granted, currently they're not configurable on insertion, but this will hopefully be tackled soon.

> if you want to run headless, but want to test with the GUI then you'll need two separate world files

As described above, not necessarily 2 world files, but yes, ign-gui still lacks a couple of features to make that convenient.

> reduce the number of options a user has to deal with

I agree with that, but I don't think removing flexibility is the solution. Instead, I think we should figure out how to give the users good default behaviour.

---

In any case, I'm not opposed to moving this out of a system. I'll work on that soon.
